summary: Modern, high-end Apple-inspired portfolio website for a short-form video editor/reels editor/graphic designer with black + neon green “soft glass/bubble” UI, smooth motion, and responsive sections (Hero, About, Portfolio, Services, Testimonials, Contact).
architectural_notes: Mobile-first, fully responsive layout with high-contrast readability and modern spacing.
Visual style: mostly black background with subtle gradients and floating bubble elements; soft-glass UI with rounded corners, soft shadows, and subtle depth.
Brand colors: black base with bright neon green accents for buttons/highlights/hover states.
Typography: bold modern sans-serif with strong hierarchy.
Motion: smooth scroll and subtle hover/transition animations (no flashy effects).
Portfolio content update: add specific external video links (YouTube Shorts + Instagram Reels) to the correct portfolio categories and render via existing video/preview support.
Portfolio content management: when updating with new user-provided video links, remove/replace any previously uploaded/older video items so the portfolio reflects only the latest set.
known_issues: User requested About Me photo replacement but the actual image file was not provided in the conversation payload.

existing_features.title: Implement a single-page, fully responsive portfolio website with these sections in order: Home/Hero, About Me, Portfolio, Services, Testimonials (placeholder), Contact.

Apply a clean, bold, premium, Apple-inspired visual theme using a black background, subtle gradients, neon green accents, and a soft-glass/bubble UI style (rounded corners, soft shadows, subtle depth, smooth transitions). Ensure high contrast and readability.

Add smooth scrolling navigation between sections (e.g., header links or in-page CTAs) and apply subtle motion: smooth scroll behavior, soft hover animations, and gentle section/element transitions (no flashy effects).

Create the Home/Hero section with: a large bold headline containing the name and title, a one-line description focused on results/creativity, a primary CTA button labeled “View Portfolio” that scrolls to the Portfolio section, and a secondary CTA labeled “Contact Me” that scrolls to the Contact section. Include floating bubble/glass decorative elements in the hero background.

Create the About Me section with a clean two-column layout (image + text) that collapses gracefully on mobile. Include a short professional bio emphasizing creativity, storytelling, and social media impact. Include a tools area rendered as icons or badges for: Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator.

Create the Portfolio section divided into three clear categories: Short-Form Reels (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts), Video Editing Projects, and Graphic Design / Thumbnails. For each category, render a responsive grid of project tiles with thumbnails, hover effects that reveal project type, and click-to-open preview/expanded view (modal or drawer). Use placeholder project items and placeholder thumbnails if no real assets are provided.

Create the Services section with bold service cards for: Short-Form Video Editing, Reels Editing, Motion Graphics, Thumbnail Design, Social Media Content Editing. Cards must use bright neon green accents on hover/focus (border/glow/background accent) while keeping overall premium minimal styling.
Create a Testimonials section as an optional placeholder with minimal, clean quote cards containing placeholder client feedback text.

Create a Contact section containing: a heading/CTA “Let’s Work Together”, a simple contact form with fields Name, Email, Message, and social links for Instagram, YouTube, and Behance. Form submission should validate required fields and show an on-page success state/confirmation (no external email integration required).
Add an optional dark/light mode toggle while keeping neon green as the consistent brand accent color in both modes. Default to dark mode.

Add generated static visual assets for the bubble/soft-glass background and use them in the UI via frontend static assets (served from frontend/public/assets/generated), without routing images through the backend.

Extend the portfolio item data model to support real video media in addition to static thumbnails, so each portfolio item can optionally define a video source (either an external embed URL or a locally-served video file) while keeping backward compatibility with existing placeholder image-only items.

Update the Portfolio preview experience to play videos when a selected portfolio item includes a video source, and otherwise continue showing the current image preview; ensure the video preview is responsive, accessible, and matches the existing glass/neon styling.

Update the Portfolio grid tiles to visually indicate which portfolio items have a playable video (without changing the overall layout), and provide a clear, user-facing hint in English in the Portfolio section that videos can be added via links/embeds or local files.

Update the Hero headline to include a new top line of text exactly "i'm Arnav" displayed above the existing title text "Creative Video Editor" and "& Graphic Designer", preserving the current two-line title layout and styling (including the neon styling on "& Graphic Designer").

Populate the Portfolio data for the correct categories using the user-provided video links, so the new items appear in the grid and open as playable video embeds in the preview dialog.

Replace the About section profile photo with the user-uploaded image file `group 1.png`, using it as a static frontend asset and keeping the current responsive layout/styling intact.

Specifically, remove the existing embed URL `https://www.youtube.com/embed/dQw4w9WgXcQ` from the portfolio data so it no longer appears in the grid and cannot be opened in the preview dialog.
